channel.title: Y-Axis
channel.description: Well what do you do with it? Invert or not. I personally always invert on whatever i do. I hate it whens it not inverted because it isnt natural. Your head leans forward to look down and you pull it back to look up so it seems logical to have it that way.

item.title: Y-Axis
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I’d just use default, I guess that’s how the games developers think the game is best played so I’d keep it at that. Unless it felt more natural to do it another way.

FPS’s definitely feel better to me having it normal.

Read full topic

item.title: Y-Axis
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t know what normal is, as it’s been a while since I used a joypad. But I do know that I prefer to push it forward to look up in most games, except in flying games. IRL, if you push a joystick forward in a plane, you dive.

Read full topic

item.title: Y-Axis
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

[quote=“Kaza, post:3, topic:249415”]Well, if you’re talking about FPS, i just use normal.

The only time i would ever use inverted, it would be some kind of plane / flying game.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Y-Axis
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

i was more realting to consoles with analog sticks but i suppose in computers it applys. I always use inverted its just so much more normal

Read full topic

item.title: Y-Axis
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

I agree with Kaza and Mopman, it feels more natural to use non-inverted unless you are using a game where a “joystick feel” is needed.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

i perfer to press up to look up and press down to look down
